(OOC) 
Thanks for outlining the base for me. Definitely will turn out to be=
 
of some help at one point or another. Oh, and if anyone cares, I say 
tha=
t instead of making a sequel, we should just restart. It would 
really help=
 people, I think, to get a character and stick with them 
through the story=
line enthusiastically if someone who didn't get a 
chance to be influential=
 in this game got the option of helping build 
from a clean slate and work =
on their own part of the storyline. That 
way they could feel like their ch=
aracter and gaming posts actually 
have an impact on the world if they didn=
't get that chance this time 
around. 

(IC)
Skullhammer laughed. The deep,=
 gravelly laugh came from deep within 
his mechanical vocal system. "Join y=
ou! I wish! Have you seen this 
body? The sensory suite of my pod launched =
early and read an 
elephant. I also came in WAY off course." He smiled, pau=
sed, and 
stood still for a moment. "It was intended that I come to the 
Au=
tobots to get a vehicular form, and thus I was supposed to land 
here, at t=
he base. Or close to, anyway. However, my pod's computer 
screwed up my thr=
usters all to slag. I came in far to low and early 
and screamed right over=
=85what did they call it? Umm, Africa? Yes. The 
computers burnt right out =
and launched the sensory orb. I ended up 
like this. Eh, I was sent to help=
 the allied Maximal forces here on 
Earth in part anyway. They prepared me =
for the eventuality of 
becoming an animal. I would have preferred my old f=
orm, however."

Skullhammer walks closer to Pacifix and inclines his head a=
 
little. "As much as I'd like to stick around the Autobot base, and 
see s=
ome familiar styles and procedures, I suppose I have to at least 
repot to =
the Maximals. Whereabouts are the friendly bases? And what 
is the Maximal =
and allied forces statuses on this planet?"
